page.title: 02Newtown Mart
page.content: Newtown Mart was built in 1871 and is one of two main livestock markets in the Borders. Although now disused,the {railway}once ran through Newtown, and as the village is in a fairly central position,transport of livestock to and fro was facilitated. Marts are held twice weekly on Mondays and Thursdays. There are two main types of sales: fat sales where livestock is sold for slaughter or stores sales where animals are sold for further rearing.Farmers,butchers and members of the public come from all round the Borders to sell or buy livestock, or just to have a look. Pigs are sold in a small ring while sheep and cattle are sold in two large rings.Poultry is sold in a small shed near the pig ring.
